documents.title: DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document introduces DSPy, a declarative framework that enables developers to build modular AI systems by programming with structured modules rather than manually engineering prompts.

documents.title: Learning DSPy - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document outlines the iterative three-stage process for building AI systems with DSPy, covering programming, evaluation, and optimization.

documents.title: Cheatsheet - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document provides a collection of quick-reference code snippets and frequent usage patterns for DSPy modules, metrics, evaluation, and optimizers.

documents.title: FAQ - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document provides answers to frequently asked questions about the DSPy framework, highlighting its differences from other libraries and explaining core concepts like signatures, modules, and optimizers.

documents.title: Roadmap - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document outlines the technical roadmap and strategic goals for the DSPy framework as it transitions toward versions 2.5 and 3.0. It details plans for enhancing modular LM programming, improving prompt optimizers, and refining the core library's architectural abstractions.

documents.title: Programming Overview - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document outlines the programming philosophy of DSPy, emphasizing a modular approach to building LLM systems by separating task signatures from pipeline logic and optimization.

documents.title: Language Models - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to initialize and configure language models in DSPy, covering various providers, authentication methods, and global or contextual model management.

documents.title: Signatures - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use DSPy Signatures to declaratively define the input and output behavior of language model modules using inline strings or class-based structures.

documents.title: Modules - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document introduces DSPy modules as the foundational building blocks for language model programs, explaining how to declare, configure, and execute various prompting techniques through a unified interface.

documents.title: Adapters - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains the role of Adapters in the DSPy framework as the bridge between structured signatures and language model communication. It details how adapters handle prompt formatting, response parsing, and configuration within a DSPy workflow.

documents.title: Tools - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate external functions and APIs into DSPy workflows using automated reasoning with ReAct or manual tool management.

documents.title: MCP - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with DSPy to provide standardized tools to agents via HTTP or Stdio servers. It provides instructions for installing the necessary dependencies and converting MCP tools into DSPy-compatible tools.

documents.title: DSPy Assertions - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document describes the implementation of DSPy Assertions and Suggestions for enforcing computational constraints and enabling model self-refinement via backtracking. It explains the mechanics of dynamic signature modification and the differences between hard assertions and soft suggestions in LM pipelines.

documents.title: Evaluation Overview - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document outlines the systematic process for evaluating DSPy programs, covering dataset collection, metric definition, and iterative performance analysis.

documents.title: Data Handling - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the DSPy Example class to represent data points, training sets, and test sets while distinguishing between inputs and labels.

documents.title: Metrics - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to define and implement automatic metrics in DSPy for evaluating and optimizing machine learning programs, covering both simple functions and complex AI-feedback metrics.

documents.title: Optimization Overview - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document outlines the iterative workflow for using DSPy optimizers, providing guidance on data collection, dataset splitting strategies, and refining program components.

documents.title: Optimizers - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of DSPy optimizers, which are algorithms designed to tune prompt instructions and language model weights to maximize program accuracy. It categorizes and describes available optimization methods for few-shot learning, instruction optimization, and model fine-tuning.

documents.title: Examples - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Example class in DSPy to manage data for training and evaluation, including methods for defining inputs and labels.

documents.title: Built in datasets - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to utilize built-in datasets like HotPotQA in DSPy and provides a deep dive into the Dataset class mechanics for sampling and shuffling data. It demonstrates how to load datasets and convert them into standardized Example objects for use in training and evaluation.

documents.title: Loading custom data - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and load custom datasets in DSPy by converting raw data into Example objects using either standard Python logic or the built-in Dataset class.

documents.title: ChainOfThought - DSPy

documents.title: BestOfN - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: The BestOfN module executes a specified sub-module multiple times to identify the prediction that best satisfies a reward function or exceeds a defined threshold. It provides a structured way to optimize model outputs through repeated sampling and scoring logic.

documents.title: Refine - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: The dspy.Refine module iteratively executes a specified DSPy module up to a maximum number of attempts to find a prediction that satisfies a reward-based threshold. It aims to improve prediction quality by leveraging multiple rollouts and automated feedback generation.

documents.title: KNNFewShot - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains the KNNFewShot optimizer in DSPy, which dynamically retrieves relevant training examples using k-nearest neighbors to serve as demonstrations during module inference.

documents.title: COPRO - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains the implementation of an iterative prompt optimization algorithm that refines instructions and output prefixes for language model predictors by evaluating candidate versions against a training dataset.

documents.title: MIPROv2 - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the compile method for a prompt optimizer, detailing the process of bootstrapping few-shot examples and proposing instructions to optimize a student program.

documents.title: SIMBA - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document provides the implementation of the compile method for the SIMBA optimizer, which improves DSPy modules by sampling program trajectories and applying optimization strategies based on performance scores.

documents.title: InferRules - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document provides the API reference for dspy.InferRules, an optimizer that enhances DSPy programs by inducing natural language rules from examples and refining predictor instructions.

documents.title: BetterTogether - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the BetterTogether class in DSPy, an experimental optimizer that coordinates sequential prompt and weight optimization strategies for LLM programs.

documents.title: Ensemble - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: The dspy.Ensemble class is a teleprompter that combines multiple DSPy programs into a single ensembled module, optionally using a reduction function to process outputs.

documents.title: 1. GEPA Overview - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: dspy.GEPA is a reflective prompt optimizer that evolves textual components using Genetic-Pareto algorithms and textual feedback to improve system performance. It leverages execution traces and reflection models to identify and fix bottlenecks in prompts through iterative evolution.

documents.title: 2. GEPA Advanced - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document explains how to customize and implement instruction proposers within the dspy.GEPA optimizer for advanced prompt refinement and multi-modal handling.

documents.title: configure_cache - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document describes the dspy.configure_cache function, which is used to manage settings for on-disk and in-memory caching within the DSPy framework.

documents.title: asyncify - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: Explains how to use the dspy.asyncify function to wrap DSPy programs for asynchronous execution while maintaining thread-local configuration.

documents.title: streamify - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This function wraps a DSPy program to enable incremental streaming of outputs and status messages instead of returning results all at once.

documents.title: StreamListener - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: The StreamListener class provides a mechanism to monitor and capture real-time streaming output from specific signature fields within DSPy predictors across multiple adapter formats.

documents.title: StatusMessage - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the StatusMessage dataclass, which is used to wrap message strings for status streaming within the DSPy framework.

documents.title: StatusMessageProvider - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the StatusMessageProvider base class used for creating and customizing status message streaming during various stages of DSPy program execution.

documents.title: enable_logging - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document describes the enable_logging function in DSPy, which activates the logging stream to emit event logs from internal APIs.

documents.title: disable_logging - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: Explains how to disable the internal DSPy event logging stream to silence all subsequent event logs from the library.

documents.title: enable_litellm_logging - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This utility function enables detailed logging for LiteLLM within the DSPy framework by setting the log level to DEBUG and unsuppressing debug information.

documents.title: disable_litellm_logging - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document describes the dspy.disable_litellm_logging function, which suppresses debug information and sets the LiteLLM logging level to error-only.

documents.title: inspect_history - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document describes the inspect_history utility in DSPy, which allows users to view the global history of interactions across all language models.

documents.title: load - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the dspy.load function, which is used to deserialize and load saved DSPy modules from a specified path using cloudpickle.

documents.title: Citations - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: This document defines the dspy.experimental.Citations class, which provides a structured way to handle and extract source-referenced citations from language model responses. It includes utilities for parsing native LM citation features, managing quoted text, and converting citation data between formats.

documents.title: Document - DSPy
documents.description: The framework for programming—rather than prompting—language models.
documents.summary: Defines the experimental Document class in DSPy, which facilitates providing structured text content and metadata for citation-enabled language model interactions.
